questiontext.text:
The reaction times are normally distributed with mean 262 milliseconds and standard deviation 40 milliseconds.

Part A: P(X < 237.2) = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.2676:0.001}

Part B: P(X > 286) = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.2743:0.001}

Part C: P(237.2 < X < 286) = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.4581:0.001}

Part D: 27th percentile = {1:NUMERICAL:=355:0.5} milliseconds
Find P(-0.92 < Z < 1.08) where Z is a standard normal random variable.

generalfeedback.text:
Solution: P(-0.92 < Z < 1.08)

Step 1: Use subtraction rule: P(a < Z < b) = P(Z < b) - P(Z < a)

Step 2: Find P(Z < 1.08) = 0.8599

Step 3: Find P(Z < -0.92) = 0.1788

Step 4: P(-0.92 < Z < 1.08) = 0.8599 - 0.1788 = 0.6811

Answer: 0.6811

questiontext.text: Find P(Z > -0.13) where Z is a standard normal random variable.

generalfeedback.text:
Solution: P(Z > -0.13)

Step 1: Use complement rule: P(Z > z) = 1 - P(Z ≤ z)

Step 2: Find P(Z ≤ -0.13) = 0.4483

Step 3: P(Z > -0.13) = 1 - 0.4483 = 0.5517

Answer: 0.5517

questiontext.text: The standardized test scores are normally distributed with mean 835 points and standard deviation 102 points. What is the probability that a randomly selected measurement is less than 720.76 points?

generalfeedback.text:
Solution: Normal Distribution Application

Given: μ = 835 points, σ = 102 points

Find: P(X < 720.8 points)

Step 1: Standardize using z = (X - μ) / σ

Step 2: z = (720.8 - 835) / 102 = -1.12

Step 3: P(X < 720.8) = P(Z < -1.12) = 0.1314

Answer: 0.1314

questiontext.text: Find P(Z > -0.29) where Z is a standard normal random variable.

generalfeedback.text:
Solution: P(Z > -0.29)

Step 1: Use complement rule: P(Z > z) = 1 - P(Z ≤ z)

Step 2: Find P(Z ≤ -0.29) = 0.3859

Step 3: P(Z > -0.29) = 1 - 0.3859 = 0.6141

Answer: 0.6141

questiontext.text: Find P(0.49 < Z < 2.2) where Z is a standard normal random variable.

generalfeedback.text:
Solution: P(0.49 < Z < 2.2)

Step 1: Use subtraction rule: P(a < Z < b) = P(Z < b) - P(Z < a)

Step 2: Find P(Z < 2.2) = 0.9861

Step 3: Find P(Z < 0.49) = 0.6879

Step 4: P(0.49 < Z < 2.2) = 0.9861 - 0.6879 = 0.2982

Answer: 0.2982

questiontext.text: Find the z-score that corresponds to the 81th percentile of the standard normal distribution.

generalfeedback.text:
Solution: Find z-score for 81th percentile

Step 1: Convert percentile to probability: 81% = 0.81

Step 2: Find z such that P(Z < z) = 0.81

Step 3: Use inverse normal table or calculator

Step 4: z = 2.33

Answer: 2.33

questiontext.text:
The human heights are normally distributed with mean 173 cm and standard deviation 12 cm.

Part A: P(X < 163.3) = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.209:0.001}

Part B: P(X > 196.9) = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.0233:0.001}

Part C: P(163.3 < X < 196.9) = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.7677:0.001}

Part D: 51th percentile = {1:NUMERICAL:=200.9:0.5} cm
Find P(Z > 0.33) where Z is a standard normal random variable.

generalfeedback.text:
Solution: P(Z > 0.33)

Step 1: Use complement rule: P(Z > z) = 1 - P(Z ≤ z)

Step 2: Find P(Z ≤ 0.33) = 0.6293

Step 3: P(Z > 0.33) = 1 - 0.6293 = 0.3707

Answer: 0.3707

questiontext.text: The human heights are normally distributed with mean 179 cm and standard deviation 9 cm. What is the probability that a randomly selected measurement is less than 196.64 cm?

generalfeedback.text:
Solution: Normal Distribution Application

Given: μ = 179 cm, σ = 9 cm

Find: P(X < 196.6 cm)

Step 1: Standardize using z = (X - μ) / σ

Step 2: z = (196.6 - 179) / 9 = 1.96

Step 3: P(X < 196.6) = P(Z < 1.96) = 0.975

Answer: 0.975

questiontext.text: Find P(Z < 1.02) where Z is a standard normal random variable.

generalfeedback.text:
Solution: P(Z < 1.02)

Step 1: Use standard normal table or calculator

Step 2: Look up z = 1.02

Step 3: P(Z < 1.02) = 0.8461

Answer: 0.8461

questiontext.text: Find P(-2.27 < Z < 1.59) where Z is a standard normal random variable.

generalfeedback.text:
Solution: P(-2.27 < Z < 1.59)

Step 1: Use subtraction rule: P(a < Z < b) = P(Z < b) - P(Z < a)

Step 2: Find P(Z < 1.59) = 0.9441

Step 3: Find P(Z < -2.27) = 0.0116

Step 4: P(-2.27 < Z < 1.59) = 0.9441 - 0.0116 = 0.9325

Answer: 0.9325
